text: Janet E. Turner (1914, Kansas City, Missouri – 1988, Chico, California) was an American artist known for her printmaking. Her work is included in the collections of the Seattle Art Museum, the Smithsonian American Art Museum, the Portland Art Museum the Dallas Museum of Art, the Pennsylvania Academy of Fine Arts and the Nelson-Atkins Museum of Art. Turner was a professor of art at California State University, Chico between 1959 and 1981. The Janet Turner Print Museum at the university was created in her name. ==References== Category:1914 births Category:1988 deaths Category:20th-century American women artists
title: Janet E. Turner
